FuncDef: This command defines a LAG which is forming a redundant-pair for MC-LAG with a LAG configured on the given peer. The same LAG group can be defined only in the scope of 1 peer.

ParaDef.Info: The LAG identifier, expressed as a decimal integer. Specifying the lag-id allows the mismatch between lag-id on redundant-pair. If no lag-id is specified it is assumed that neighbor system uses the same lag-id as a part of the given MC-LAG. If no matching MC-LAG group can be found between neighbor systems, the individual LAGs will operate normally (no MC-LAG operation is established). Values-1 to 800.
Specifies a 16 bit key that needs to be configured in the same manner on both sides of the MC-LAG in order for the MC-LAG to come up. Values-1 to 65535.
Specifies a 6 byte value expressed in the same notation as MAC address. Values-xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx     - xx [00 to FF].
Specifies the LAG ID on the remote system. Values-1 to 200 (applies to the 7450 ESS).

Specifies the system priority to be used in the context of the MC-LAG. The partner system will consider all ports using the same lacp-key, system-id, and system-priority as part of the same LAG. Values-1 to 65535.
